body_html:
Sorry I wasn't clear: The headers are not a problem with the Docker image (which does have the headers in the same folder), but with the Linux build process described here.

The problem with the Docker image are the missing symbols in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so.
body_text:
Sorry I wasn't clear: The headers are not a problem with the Docker image (which does have the headers in the same folder), but with the Linux build process described here.
The problem with the Docker image are the missing symbols in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so.
body:
Sorry I wasn't clear: The headers are not a problem with the Docker image (which does have the headers in the same folder), but with the Linux build process described [here](https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources).

The problem with the Docker image are the missing symbols in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so.
